intro: Zigadenus micranthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved death camis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its showy, camis-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant contains toxic alkaloids, making it highly poisonous to both humans and animals. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its toxicity, it is important to avoid contact with any part of the plant.
